alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 15 at 3:53PM EDT until August 15 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: The National Weather Service in Miami has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Miami-Dade County in southeastern Florida... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 353 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... The Redland, Richmond West, Country Walk, The Hammocks, Inlikita and Three Lakes. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
